raw_text:
{
  "base_id": "base_thyroid_0179",
  "assessment": "The patient is a 65-74 year old female with hypothyroidism currently taking levothyroxine 100mcg daily. Vital signs and labs are within template ranges except for a mildly elevated TSH at 5.2 µIU/mL, with a low normal free T4 of 0.9 ng/dL. This suggests suboptimal thyroid hormone replacement, possibly indicating under-treatment or non-compliance. Kidney function is within normal limits (Cr 1.0 mg/dL).",
  "recommendations": [
    "Consider evaluating for adherence to levothyroxine therapy and timing of medication relative to meals or other medications.",
    "Repeat thyroid function tests (TSH and free T4) in 6-8 weeks after ensuring proper medication administration.",
    "Adjust levothyroxine dose if TSH remains elevated and free T4 is low or low-normal, to achieve TSH within the target range (approximately 0.5-4.0 µIU/mL) per guidelines.",
    "Continue monitoring renal function and vital signs routinely.",
    "Educate patient on importance of consistent daily intake of levothyroxine on an empty stomach and avoiding interfering substances."
  ],
  "disclaimer": "FOR EVALUATION ONLY - NOT CLINICAL USE."
}
